article_node.title: Lagarde Says Central-Bank Independence Is Critically Important
article_node.summary: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde emphasized the importance of central bank independence, warning that government interference in setting interest rates can lead to dysfunction and instability. She drew on her experience at the IMF to illustrate how threatened independence can derail policy. Lagarde also noted that in the U.S., Fed Chair Jerome Powell faces criticism from President Donald Trump over rate decisions, while officials at Jackson Hole expressed support for him.
